content.description:
Straight Laced is a nasty, crimp problem that ascends perfect, incut edges.

Stand start with a pair of crimps about six feet off the ground, and thin, almost non-existent feet.  From there, hit a right hand sloping crimp, bump the left hand up to a shallow, incut sidepull (crux), work the feet up, and continue to the finish by using the remaining sidepulls.

Staying low on the start holds is key in executing the first move.
content.protection: At least a few pads, as the landing is uneven due to a large rock that sits slightly left of the problem.
content.location:
The problem ascends the south face in between

Barn Chicken Brown Cow

and

Flagship Blur

.

content.description:
This is a combination of

Endolith

and

Falling For Fall

. Start as for

Endolith

, and when you can undercling the flake at mid-height, begin a traverse left with high feet into

Falling For Fall

to top out. It makes either of these routes easier for those of shorter stature.
content.location:
Start as for

Endolith

in the center of the north face of Barn Block.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, reach a left hand edge, then get a good right hand sidepull, bring the feet up, gain the seam at the sloping shelf, reach the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is very good.
content.location:
It climbs the center of Barn's north face in between

Endolith

and

Arrow of Time

.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand two finger pocket and a right hand sidepull.  From there, work the vertical face by getting a high left foot, then move to a thin, right hand pinch, stick the incut crimp, pull up (crux) to the good edges, and finish up the juggy topout.
content.protection: A pad or two would suffice, the landing is clear and flat.
content.location:
On the South face of Barn Block, it lies left of

Brown Chicken Brown Cow

.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand crimp and right hand on the arete. From there, work up the slight overhanging arete using the generous pinches and crimps to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: A pad should suffice, as the landing is quite good.
content.location: This ascends the southeast arete of Barn Block.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge on the featured shelf. From there, climb straight up to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. It has a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Barn's north face.

content.description: Stand start with a right hand edge and a great left hand inverted-sidepull-pinch. From there, pull up to a right hand edge, bring a high left foot along, stand up strong on the foot, make a big move to the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. It has a great landing.
content.location:
It climbs the center of Barn's north face, in between

Falling For Fall

and

Phony Tail

.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of thin crimps at chest height.  Work straight up the vertical face through a three-finger pocket and a rail to reach the decent sloper-crimp below the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads should suffice, the landing below this problem is great.
content.location: This ascends the center of Barn Block's south face.

content.description: Sit start below the arete with any hand combination. From there, work up through a pair of jugs, gain the feet, then stand tall to a left hand sidepull on the face. At that point, work up to the lip/pinch, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads is fine, the landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Barn Block.
